alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 13 at 1:02PM EST until January 13 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST FOR NORTHERN MONROE COUNTY... At 102 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Monroe, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 15 and 24. I-275 between mile markers 1 and 4. US-23 between mile markers 16 and 24. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Milan, Dundee, Carleton, Maybee, Estral Beach, Newport, Cone, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Azalia, Scofield, and Detroit Beach. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
